title: Hookah
summary: A hookah (Hindustani: حقّہ (Nastaleeq), हुक़्क़ा (Devanagari), IPA: [ˈɦʊqːa]; also see other names),[1][2][3] shisha,[3] or waterpipe[3] is a single- or multi-stemmed instrument for heating or vaporizing and then smoking either tobacco, flavored tobacco (often muʽassel), or sometimes cannabis, hashish, and opium.[3] The smoke is passed through a water basin—often glass-based—before inhalation.[3][4][5][6][7]
